channel.title: Math Homwork help! Pre Algebra
channel.description:
Can anyone help me with my math home work here are the questions Ps: pre algebra
Find each unit rate.
1. 78 mi on 3 gal
2. $52.50 in 7 h
3. 416 mi in 8 h
4. 9 bull's eyes in 117 throws
Write each ratio as a fraction in simplest form.
Boys Girls 7th grade 26 34 8th grade 30 22
5. 7th grade boys to 8th grade boys
6. 7th grade girls to 7th grade boys
7. 7th graders to 8th graders
8. boys to girls
9. girls to all students
Write each ratio as a fraction in simplest form.
13. 7 : 12 14. 3 is to 16 15. 10:45 16. 32 out of 40 17. 36 is to 60 18. 13 out of 14 19. 9 out of 21 20. 45:63 21. 24 is to 18 22. 15 out of 60

item.title: Math Homwork help! Pre Algebra
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

zammyking111:

Well i dont listen in class

My advice is that you do if you expect to get anywhere. Of course, if living off government payouts sounds better to you then so be it. I’m sure people living like that have nice lives. If you save enough, you might be able to afford dialup internet access.

Read full topic

item.title: Math Homwork help! Pre Algebra
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

that cant be algebra. if anything, its only pre-algebra. its only reducing, and you needed help. I cant wait to see how hard you take 2x=15.
if your in 8th grade, then damn you have easy curriculum. then again i was taking geometry in 8th grade

item.title: Math Homwork help! Pre Algebra
item.dc:creator: @zammyking111 zammyking111
item.description:
@zammyking111 wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:2, topic:44151”]are you joking? how old are you? these are probably the easiest problems ever. This is somewhere around…5th grade hw?
first one. all you do is divide 78 by 3. same way all the way down the list.
for the simplest form of a fraction, you have to find a Lowest number that they have in common. LCD i think it was. ex: 15 out of 60. off the bat you know 15 goes into 15 once, and 60 four times. so it becomes 1 out of 4.[/quote] first off this is 8th grade algebra so stfu and thanks lothy

Read full topic

item.title: Math Homwork help! Pre Algebra
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

  1. 78 mi on 3 gal - 26 miles on each galleon of fuel.

  2. $52.50 in 7 h - $7.50 per hour. If you’re over 13 you’re getting ripped off.

  3. 416 mi in 8 h - 52 miles average speed each hour.

  4. 9 bull’s eyes in 117 throws - You’re pretty fucking shit.

Write each ratio as a fraction in simplest form.

                                                      Boys           Girls
                                       7th grade       26             34
                                       8th grade       30             22

  1. 7th grade boys to 8th grade boys - 26:30 = 13:15

  2. 7th grade girls to 7th grade boys - 34:26 = 17:13

  3. 7th graders to 8th graders - 60:52 = 30:26 = 15:13

  4. boys to girls - 56:56 = 1

  5. girls to all students - 56:112 = 28:56 = 14:28 = 7:14

You do the rest.

Read full topic

item.title: Math Homwork help! Pre Algebra
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

are you joking? how old are you? these are probably the easiest problems ever. This is somewhere around…5th grade hw?
first one. all you do is divide 78 by 3. same way all the way down the list.
for the simplest form of a fraction, you have to find a Lowest number that they have in common. LCD i think it was. ex: 15 out of 60. off the bat you know 15 goes into 15 once, and 60 four times. so it becomes 1 out of 4.

Read full topic
